unit_learning_outcomes.description: Adapt orientation and mobility teaching techniques to support the development and learning attributes of individuals with vision impairment across the age spectrum
Promote independence in people with vision impairment of all ages by supporting modes of orientation and mobility that focus on safety
Demonstrate an understanding of orientation concepts as they relate to assistive technology devices and mapping skills.

Display inclusive team principles by adapting regular instructional programs to promote orientation and mobility knowledge and skills for individuals with vision impairment, including for sport, physical education, daily living, independent travel and practical activities

assessments.description: Research paper on an aspect of orientation and mobility which has implications for instruction of individuals with vision impairment. (2500 words)
Part (a): Tactile map or diagram. Part (b) Plans for three teaching sessions

assessments.assessment_title: Practical application of  O&M knowledge and skills
assessments.description: Assesses instruction and performance of O&M techniques

data.description: This unit examines the theory and practice of orientation and mobility (O&M) for children and adults who are blind, have low vision, deafblindness or additional disabilities, within a range of learning environments. Unit content includes an introduction to foundational principles of concept development, spatial orientation and environmental analysis, with practical opportunities to teach and learn orientation and mobility concepts and skills. (Unit requires 5 day intensive attendance at RIDBC North Rocks, Sydney.)
